CREVASSES.Definition: deep, crack-like openings in ice or glaciers

SEAL.Definition: sea animal often found in cold regions

GET THE WORD OUT.Definition: spread information or news to others

HEADLINE.Definition: main news or story title in a newspaper

NICKNAME.Definition: familiar or humorous name given to him

CHARLATAN.Definition: someone who pretended to have skills or knowledge he didn't possess

COME UP SHORT.Definition: fail to achieve a desired goal or result

TINNED.Definition: preserved or canned in a sealed container

SLEIGH.Definition: vehicle for travelling over snow, typically pulled by animals

INDIGENOUS.Definition: native to that place or region

VOLUNTEER.Definition: someone who offered to do it willingly and without pay

BE ON HIS WAY.Definition: continue or proceed with the journey

HAD HIS SIGHTS FIRMLY SET ON.Definition: was determined to achieve his goal

EXAGGERATION.Definition: statement that makes it seem more important that it really was, overstatement

SUMMITTING.Definition: reaching its highest point or peak

SLEDGES.Definition: vehicles typically used on snow or ice

RECALL.Definition: remember or bring back to his mind

SEXTANT.Definition: a navigational instrument used to measure angles between sky objects

AMMUNITION.Definition: objects that can be shot from a weapon

BULLETS.Definition: small metal projectiles fired from guns

HIBERNATE.Definition: remain inactive for an extended period

SEALS.Definition: sea mammals with flippers, often found in polar regions

FARED.Definition: managed or got along in this situation

STROLL IN THE PARK.Definition: easy and relaxed activity or task

DISCREDIT.Definition: cause doubt about the truth or reliability of his claim

CAST DOUBT ON.Definition: raise suspicions or uncertainty about it

SEXTANTS.Definition: navigational instruments used to measure angles between sky objects

GOOD GOING.Definition: better than usual or than expected
